title: I visited 5 'toxin-filled' pods that simulated the air in places like Beijing and New Delhi, and I could barely breathe
text:
Scottish artist Michael Pinsky designed air pollution pods to give people a feel for what it's like to breathe the air in different cities around the world.

The air pods mimic breathing conditions in Tautra, London, New Delhi, Beijing, and São Paulo.

Pinsky says the smells were created by perfumers native to each city, and they are all harmless. But the ozone machine that simulates smoggy air in Brazil may not be.

When I stepped inside the "air" of New Delhi, I was near knocked out, while in the London pod, it smelled smoky and looked a bit hazy.

Visit Insider's homepage for more stories.

NEW YORK — It's hot, it's humid, and I am having trouble breathing.

I'm standing inside a hazy plastic dome, just over 19 feet wide, with blades of grass growing beneath my feet, a blazing September sun over my head, and three oil-filled radiators hissing at me.

This is what it's like to breathe in New Delhi, India.

Or, at least, this is the space artist Michael Pinsky has built to help people around the world understand what it may feel like to breathe in New Delhi, without all the life-threatening and lung-harming health effects.

Pinsky is the creator of five "air pollution pods," a sensory art exhibit from British non-profit climate change think tank Cape Farewell, which has traveled to nine cities around the world. The exhibit mimics for visitors what it feels like to inhale and exhale in the cities of Tautra, Norway; London, England; New Delhi, India; Beijing, China; and São Paulo, Brazil.

"The causes of air pollution and the causes of climate change are very, very similar," Pinsky told Insider, while standing in the shadow of his pods during a stop in New York for the UN climate summit.

Take a peek at what I saw, and also, what I smelled and felt when I stepped inside his five air chambers.
description: Scottish artist Michael Pinsky designed air pollution pods to give people a feel for what it's like to breathe in different cities around the world.
